1567454449_13VoN9gGPqenYYp56NTtHdbZuAoka.body:
> [gitcenter](#comment_950_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): It looks like the dots represent time since last ID registration. There are 1 to 4 dots. You can also get 2 dots (iirc) if you're spamming but ZeroID detects that you're not real.

I have a different theory. I think the dots might represent the subnet level that is being blocked. I found this when trying to create another account after resetting my dynamic address and being offered two dots.
Since a lot of Tor exit nodes live in the same subnet because of being run from a cluster of servers, it would make sense that if subnets are blocked after a few individual IPs being blocked, in a short amount of time all the exit nodes would be blocked.

> [peerco](#comment_35_14mdo8Vynym8XLbab1YXoNhLndUGT3t1zi): I have troubles with peering between peers and not only over tor [...]

That's a different issue. We're talking about making new IDs.
